ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend the course to another student. It is a great introduction to U.S. history in the 20th century and the Professor's guidance helps the broad topic be more manageable.

I took this course as an undergraduate, so it offered a very different experience than I was used to. In focusing on the historiography of the 20th century as much as the history of the 20th century, the discourse seemed elevated to a further degree of abstraction than that in most undergraduate history seminars, but nothing seemed to be sacrificed as a result. Professor Gage is also outstanding.
It's a great introduction to themes in 20th century US history.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course offered greater context to the topics I am studying.
It was extremely helpful for me in framing the trends in the craft of history in the twentieth century by juxtaposing generations of historians.
I hadn't taken a US history course before, so I found it to be very informative and useful. It also met the regional history requirement of my degree.
